alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:32PM EDT until May 26 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HARLAN AND NORTHEASTERN BELL COUNTIES... At 530 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Stony Fork Junction, or 8 miles northeast of Pineville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Field. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
